name: Days Inn Hamden

reviews.title: Worse then your typical Days inn
reviews.text: Even for a Days Inn, this hotel was not up to par. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because the room was fairly clean and the surrounding area was nice. However, the staff was rude and I dont think he even spoke english... The room was clean, but looked like it was designed for the set of some 70s adult film, and was very small. I got a last min rate of 60.00 which was high for the type of motel this is... you can do alot better.

reviews.title: Days Inn, Hamden, CT
reviews.text: I've never been in a worse motel!!!! The people were rude and very unprofessional and the room was not even clean. Please follow my advice and do not go to the Hamden Days Inn. Fortunately there are many motels in that area to choose from.

Grab your sunscreen and towel for fun in the sun on nearby West Haven beaches, or explore the recreated 19th century seaside village and other fascinating exhibits at Mystic Seaport. If you are visiting in the fall, enjoy a spectacular fall foliage tour before indulging in some retail therapy at Tanger Outlet Center or Clinton Crossing Premium Outlets.We are in a prime location for prospective students and visiting parents, with Yale University, Quinnipiac University, Albertus Magnus College and Southern Connecticut State University all nearby, and the University of New Haven just 15 miles from our Hamden, CT, hotel.DINING OPTIONSEnjoy fine Italian dining paired with excellent wine at Ristorante Luce, or play pool, sing karaoke, catch TV sports action or listen to a live band as you enjoy delicious food at Whitney Bar & Grill, just a half mile from our hotel in Hamden, CT. Enjoy authentic Indian fare at Cumin India, or head to Louis’s Lunch, touted as the Birthplace of the Hamburger. Try Eli’s on Whitney for sophisticated American fare, Kumo Japanese Restaurant for Asian flavors, or if you are in the mood for tasty pizza, Pepe’s Pizza is also close by.
